page.title: 03Housing in Strensall
page.content: The{oldest houses}in Strensall are Mansfield house (1660)and Manor Farm (1695).Many older houses are built with locally made bricks and tiles from the old{Strensall brickworks. } {Modern homes}are of 2,3 and 4 bedroom designs usually of detached or semi_detached construction.Nearly all have central heating and a garage.Heat insulation is a priority,building regulations require loft and cavity wall insulation in all dwellings. Special insulation blocks are also used for internal walls by most builders.Gas,electricity and telephone services are laid to all new homes. Modern homes rarely have chimneys; gas or electric fires being fitted in most lounges.Most homes have 2 toilets the current trend is for a third toilet off the main bedroom.Nearly all new housing is for private ownership.
